passages.text: This material is neither intended to be distributed to Mainland China Investors nor to provide securities investment consultancy services within the territory of Mainland China. This material or any portion hereof may not be redistributed, sold or redistributed without the written consent of J.P. Morgan.
First Take: 2Q25 - a strong beat on revenue and PPoP

Our First Take: 2Q25 results - beat. CCB delivered the best- quality 2Q print among SOE banks, in our view. 2Q25 net profits were only \(+2\%\) y/y, 1ppt higher than JPMc, but 2Q revenue/PPoP rose \(11\% /14\%\) y/y, beating JPMc by 12ppts/16ppts. Looking into the details, NIM contracted only 3bps q/q, the most resilient among the Big 4 banks. Fee/non- fee income was \(+19\% /179\%\) y/y, reversing the contraction trend in 1Q. On asset quality, the SML ratio was - 8bps h/h, and this improvement is more notable than the peer average. We expect CCB shares to go up and outperform peers following the 2Q print.

- Resilient NIM: The sequential NIM contraction (3bps q/q) was the smallest among the Big 4 banks, and management expects deposit pricing (of lower rates) to accelerate and future rate cuts (if any) to be symmetrical, so it expects NIM contraction (y/y) to narrow sequentially.

- Strong recovery in non-NII: 2Q25 non-NII growth was \(66\%\) y/y, the strongest recovery since 3Q09, driven by a strong fee recovery \((+19\%)\) y/y), the strongest since 4Q20. Non-fee income growth was \(179\%\) y/y. For a detailed breakdown on fees, please refer to Table 6.

- Stable asset quality: The NPL ratio was flat q/q in 2Q25, at \(1.33\%\) , and the NPL coverage ratio rose by a slight 2.6ppts q/q, to \(239\%\) . LLR was \(3.18\%\) , \(+3\) bps q/q. The SML ratio was -8bps h/h. CCB expects asset quality to be stable in 2H25.

- Capital ratio the strongest: The CET 1 ratio rose 36bps q/q, to \(14.34\%\) , following the Rmb105bn capital injection in 2Q25. The share count dilution is only \(4\%\) . CCB has the strongest CET 1 ratio among SOE banks.
- We do not see any negatives in this print.
- We expect low-single-digit upward revisions on EPS post-results.
- We expect stock price to go up and outperform peers.
0939. HK, 939 HK Price: HK\$7.51 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: HK\$9.20 PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026
J.P. Morgan Securities (Asia Pacific) Limited/ J.P. Morgan Broking (Hong Kong) Limited

·Strong balance sheet with a stable source of funding: CCB has a strong deposit franchise, and interbank liability accounts for only mid-teens of interest-bearing liabilities, one of the lowest in the sector.
·CCB has one of the strongest capital positions among peers.
·Asset quality is stabilizing, with improving provision levels.
·We rate CCB-H OW on its solid fundamentals and attractive valuation.

Our Dec- 26 PT of HK\$9.20 is DDM- derived, assuming a cost of equity of \(11.25\%\) , a normalized ROE of \(9.4\%\) and a terminal date of 31 December 2027. We apply an H- share discount of \(24\%\) to our A- share valuation. Details are summarized in the valuation table below.

Key assumptions/parametersNormalized ROE9.4%Cost of capital11.25%Long-term growth4.5%Fair terminal P/BV0.72Dec-26 A-share fair value (Rmb)11.10CNYHKD1.09H-share discount-24%Dec-26 H-share PT (HK$)9.20
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates.

J.P. Morgan ratings or designations: OW = Overweight, N= Neutral, UW = Underweight, NR = Not Rated

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market

index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
